result.execSummary:
The defendant James Edward Shramek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence w/held probation 2 years - costs $443.00 - any counseling DOC may impose - attempt to obtain his DL and count 1 is dismissed and read-in along with 15 CM 443. (bond forwarded to DOC)

miscConds.notes: $243.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent

judgments.dispoDesc: Sentence w/held probation 2 years - costs $443.00 - any counseling DOC may impose - attempt to obtain his DL and count 1 is dismissed and read-in along with 15 CM 443. (bond forwarded to DOC)

supervisions.notes: 90 days county jail credit for 90 days as time served
costs as previously ordered are converted to civil judgment

judgments.dispoDesc: Probation is revoked and sentence is imposed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Edward Shramek

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Edward Shramek in court, in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15 CM 408 and 16 CT 104.  Court calls cases and recites appearances.  Court makes record - Addressed DE advised the DE he can proceed without his attorney today or continue today.  State 90 days county jail on DC and 116 days OAR with credit for 116 days time served on each case.  DE wishes to proceed today without an attorney.  Court finds DE has freely waived right to have an atty present today.

Court:  15 CM 408 - 90 days county jail credit for 90 days time served - costs to be converted to civil judgment

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 21, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant James Edward Shramek in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moved to amend count 2 to DC 947.01(1).  Court grants motion.  DE entered plea of guilty.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court:  Sentence w/held probation 2 years - costs $443.00 - any counseling DOC may impose - attempt to obtain his DL and count 1 is dismissed and read-in along with 15 CM 443. (bond forwarded to DOC)
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 14, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant James Edward Shramek in court in custody by video with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.   Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Has case in Oneida County-may include prison time.
Atty Yohnk would like more time.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Defendant James Edward Shramek in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. no resolution, leave on schedule for Judge Yackel

No abusive Contact with  - Tonya Delong
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim "Tonya Delong    " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.
